Package controller

Class MainScreenController

java.lang.Object
controller.MainScreenController
public class MainScreenController extends Object
This class creates the main screen and displays all Parts and Products in Inventory, which can then be manipulated by add, modify, or delete.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This method initializes the MainScreenController.

    • initializeTests

      public boolean initializeTests()
      This method was used for testing program logic before implementation.
      Returns:
      Return is set to false

    • onSearchPart

      public boolean onSearchPart()
      This method utilizes the searchBox to find matching parts. This method incorporates the Inventory.lookupPart method.
      Returns:
      Returns to false if no matching items are found in the parts list.

    • onSearchProduct

      public boolean onSearchProduct()
      This method utilizes the searchBox to find matching products. This method incorporates the Inventory.lookupProducts method.
      Returns:
      Returns to false if no matching items are found in the products list.

    • loadFXML

      public void loadFXML(String[] fxmlKey, javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method routes to the appropriate fxml page.
      Parameters:
      fxmlKey - is a string array containing either Add/Modify and either Part/Product, depending on which button was clicked.
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onModifyPart

      public void onModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method tests whether a Part has been selected to be modified. This is one of the methods I encountered a runtime error, which I addressed by adding a catch for NullPointerException. Without this try-catch, when I had no parts selected to be modified, I would get the following exceptions:
      InvocationTargetException, RuntimeException, and NullPointerException. I also realized that I needed to select the proper exception area (partException or productException.)
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onModifyProduct

      public void onModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method tests whether a Part has been selected to be modified.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onDeletePart

      public void onDeletePart()
      This method initializes the deletion logic for Parts.

    • setTableColumns

      public void setTableColumns()
      This method initializes the TableView to set the values.

    • onAddPart

      public void onAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method routes to the AddPartController.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is initiated when clicking the Add button in the parts section of the main screen.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onAddProduct

      public void onAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method routes to the AddProductController.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is initiated when clicking the Add button in the products section of the main screen.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • isInt

      public boolean isInt(String searchId)
      This method tests for NumberFormatException when searching either the Parts or Products tableviews.
      Parameters:
      searchId - is the user input which will follow programming logic to find relevant Inventory items.
      Returns:
      Returns true only if the searchId is an integer

    • onDeleteProduct

      public void onDeleteProduct()
      This method initializes the deletion logic for Products.

    • onExit

      public void onExit()
      This method exits the program.
